summary.para: Gets an object that represents a known folder based on an IDList. The object allows you to query certain folder properties, get the current path of the folder, redirect the folder to another location, and get the path of the folder as an .

param.name: ppkf
param.para: When this method returns, contains the address of a pointer to the object that represents the known folder.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Gets an object that represents a known folder based on a file system path. The object allows you to query certain folder properties, get the current path of the folder, redirect the folder to another location, and get the path of the folder as an .

param.name: pszPath
param.para: Pointer to a null-terminated Unicode string of length MAX_PATH that contains a path to a known folder.

param.name: mode
param.para: One of the following values that specify the precision of the match of path and known folder:
Retrieve only the specific known folder for the given file path.
If an exact match is not found for the given file path, retrieve the first known folder that matches one of its parent folders walking up the parent tree.

param.name: ppkf
param.para: When this method returns, contains the address of a pointer to the object that represents the known folder.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Gets the KNOWNFOLDERID that is the equivalent of a legacy CSIDL value.

param.name: pfid
param.para: When this method returns, contains a pointer to the KNOWNFOLDERID. This pointer is passed uninitialized.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: To call this method, the caller must have at least User privileges.

summary.para: Gets the legacy CSIDL value that is the equivalent of a given KNOWNFOLDERID.

param.name: pnCsidl
param.para: When this method returns, contains a pointer to the CSIDL value. This pointer is passed uninitialized.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
Returns S_OK if successful, or an error value otherwise, including the following:

description.para: Among other things, this value can indicate that the rfid parameter references a KNOWNFOLDERID that is not present on the system. Not all KNOWNFOLDERID values are present on all systems. Use to retrieve the set of KNOWNFOLDERID values for the current system.

remarks.para: To call this method, the caller must have at least User privileges.

summary.para: Gets an object that represents a known folder identified by its KNOWNFOLDERID. The object allows you to query certain folder properties, get the current path of the folder, redirect the folder to another location, and get the path of the folder as an .

param.name: ppkf
param.para: When this method returns, contains an interface pointer to the object that represents the folder.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
Returns S_OK if successful, or an error value otherwise, including the following:

description.para: Among other things, this value can indicate that the rfid parameter references a KNOWNFOLDERID that is not present on the system. Not all KNOWNFOLDERID values are present on all systems. Use to retrieve the set of KNOWNFOLDERID values for the current system.

remarks.para: To call this method, the caller must have at least User privileges.
Use this method when you know exactly which known folder you are looking for and want to access it directly.

summary.para: Gets an object that represents a known folder identified by its canonical name. The object allows you to query certain folder properties, get the current path of the folder, redirect the folder to another location, and get the path of the folder as an .

param.name: pszCanonicalName
param.para: A pointer to the non-localized, canonical name for the known folder, stored as a null-terminated Unicode string. If this folder is a or folder, this value is also used as the value name of the "User Shell Folders" registry settings. This value is retrieved through the pszName member of the folder's structure.

param.name: ppkf
param.para: When this method returns, contains the address of a pointer to the object that represents the known folder.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Use this method when you know exactly which known folder you are looking for and want to access it directly.

summary.para: Gets an array of all registered known folder IDs. This can be used in enumerating all known folders.

param.name: ppKFId
param.para: When this method returns, contains a pointer to an array of all KNOWNFOLDERID values registered with the system. Use to free these resources when they are no longer needed.

param.name: pCount
param.para: When this method returns, contains a pointer to the number of KNOWNFOLDERID values in the array at ppKFId. The [in] functionality of this parameter is not used.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: The caller of this method must have User privileges.
You can use or to convert the retrieved KNOWNFOLDERID values to strings.

summary.para: Redirects folder requests for common and per-user folders.

param.name: rfid
param.para: A reference to the KNOWNFOLDERID of the folder to be redirected.

param.name: hwnd
param.para: The handle of the parent window used to display copy engine progress UI dialogs when is passed in the flags parameter. If no progress dialog is needed, this value can be NULL.

param.name: pszTargetPath
param.para: A pointer to the new path for the folder. This is a null-terminated Unicode string. This value can be NULL.

param.name: cFolders
param.para: The number of KNOWNFOLDERID values in the array at pExclusion.

param.name: pExclusion
param.para: Pointer to an array of KNOWNFOLDERID values that refer to subfolders of rfid that should be excluded from the redirection. If no subfolders are excluded, this value can be NULL.

param.name: ppszError
param.para: When this method returns, contains the address of a pointer to a null-terminated Unicode string that contains an error message if one was generated. This value can be NULL.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
Returns S_OK if successful, or an error value otherwise, including the following:

description.para: Among other things, this value can indicate that the rfid parameter references a KNOWNFOLDERID that is not present on the system. Not all KNOWNFOLDERID values are present on all systems. Use to retrieve the set of KNOWNFOLDERID values for the current system.

summary.para: Adds a new known folder to the registry. Used particularly by independent software vendors (ISVs) that are adding one of their own folders to the known folder system.

param.name: rfid
param.para: A GUID that represents the known folder.

param.name: pKFD
param.para: A pointer to a valid structure that provides the details of the new folder.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Note This method updates HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE and therefore needs to be run in the context of an administrator. Setup programs need administrator privileges to register or unregister a known folder.

IKnownFolderManager.RegisterFolder attempts to verify that the new KNOWNFOLDERID does not refer to a file system path already pointed to by an existing KNOWNFOLDERID. If the new KNOWNFOLDERID is found to do so, this method fails.

Multiple KNOWNFOLDERID values for the same file system path can cause several issues, such as conflicts in the Desktop.ini file that lead to confusion as to what language or properties to show for the folder. Multiple KNOWNFOLDERID values can also cause confusion as to the address bar path or what tasks to show for the folder in Windows Explorer.
You can suppress the display of the Customize page of your known folder's Properties window. To do so, set the following registry REG_DWORD value:
remarks.code: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE Software Microsoft Windows CurrentVersion Explorer FolderDescriptions Folder GUID PropertyBag NoCustomize = 0x00000001 (1)

summary.para: Remove a known folder from the registry, which makes it unknown to the known folder system. This method does not remove the folder itself.

param.name: rfid
param.para: GUID or KNOWNFOLDERID that represents the known folder.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
Returns S_OK if successful, or an error value otherwise, including the following:

description.para: Among other things, this value can indicate that the rfid parameter references a KNOWNFOLDERID that is not present on the system. Not all KNOWNFOLDERID values are present on all systems. Use to retrieve the set of KNOWNFOLDERID values known to the current system.

remarks.para: Note This method updates HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE and needs to be run in the context of an administrator. Setup programs need administrator privileges to register or unregister a known folder.

summary.para: Exposes methods that create, enumerate or manage existing known folders.
